Posts.Title: DIEP surgery

Posts.Content: Hi I had a bilateral DIEP immediate reconstruction 30th Oct 2013. I am really pleased with the results. The first 2 days are painful especially getting in and out of bed but by day 3 I was doing it alone. I dont think it was anymore painful than my ceasarian. The most overwhelming thing for me was that having gone through chemo, 4 nodes removed and then surgery, on day 3 it suddenly dawned on me that the cancer had finally been removed. I did have a quiet tear or two in the bathroom. I would recommend that post surgery, if you feel tired, rest. I refused to do so during chemo but really needed to have a lie down for an hour in the afternoons after surgery. I have completed my exercises religiously as I was quite suprised as to how pathetic my arm movement was, and if it was not for the horrible joint pain caused by Anastrazole, I would now be feeling fantastic. I manage to workout for 45-60 mins a day to lose the weight gained by chemo and the bonus of such an op is my incredibly flat stomach. My new boobs are starting to feel part of me but do still feel 'a bit stuck on'. All in all, a big op, but a big result - no feeling of a loss of boobs or feeling a lesser person as you wake up with a new 'set'! - but that might be just my pragmatic approach. I wish you luck whatever you choose Julie
Posts.Title: Breast reconstruction

Posts.Content: Hi Sharon Im 44 and It was an easy decision for me as I did not want implants. Although the operation is very medically 'hi tech', on the receiving end, it's pretty straight forward. I had a drain in each boob and both sides of my abdomen. All were removed before discharge. Just make sure that you do your arm exercises, even if it's just for a couple of minutes. I must say, that's it is only in the last couple of weeks that I have increased my times for exercise as the Anastrazole had crippled me since November, it is finally starting to feel easier and I want want to make the most of my super flat tummy !! You will manage just fine alone. But be kind to yourself and rest when your body tells you to. Make sure you buy some 'hold in' pants as you need to wear these for a few months. I got mine from M&S. You also need to wear a gross 'old lady' bra to help form your boob shape for 3-6 months. They are vile but do the trick! Julie
